IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE HOUSING AND SERVICES TO OVERCOME HOMELESSNESS AND ADDICTION. ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ARE THE PRINCIPAL REASON FOR HOMELESSNESS IN AMERICA. DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER'S TWO SHELTERS FOR HOMELESS WOMEN, ABBA HOUSE AND HAVEN HOUSE, PROVIDE LONG TERM HOUSING FOR HOMELESS WOMEN WHO ARE COMMITTED TO A RECOVERY PROGRAM. OUR TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM IS A TWO YEAR PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES. DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER PROVIDES THE CASE MANAGEMENT WHILE THE CITY OF AMARILLO PROVIDES THE RENTAL ASSISTANCE. THE MERIDIAN APARTMENTS PROVIDE QUALITY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. THE CURRENT MONTHLY RENT IS SUBSTANTIALLY BELOW HUD APPROVED LEVELS. OUR RETAIL STORES PROVIDE JOBS AND JOB TRAINING TO THE PEOPLE IN OUR PROGRAM. ALL OF OUR PROGRAMS SUPPORT OUR MISSION.
IRS990.MissionDescription: DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE HOUSING AND SERVICES TO OVERCOME HOMELESSNESS AND ADDICTION. ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE ARE THE PRINCIPAL REASON FOR HOMELESSNESS IN AMERICA. DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER'S TWO SHELTERS FOR HOMELESS WOMEN, ABBA HOUSE AND HAVEN HOUSE, PROVIDE LONG TERM HOUSING FOR HOMELESS WOMEN WHO ARE COMMITTED TO A RECOVERY PROGRAM. OUR TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM IS A TWO YEAR PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES. DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER PROVIDES THE CASE MANAGEMENT WHILE THE CITY OF AMARILLO PROVIDES THE RENTAL ASSISTANCE. THE MERIDIAN APARTMENTS PROVIDE QUALITY, AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS. THE CURRENT MONTHLY RENT IS SUBSTANTIALLY BELOW HUD APPROVED LEVELS. OUR RETAIL STORES PROVIDE JOBS AND JOB TRAINING TO THE PEOPLE IN OUR PROGRAM. ALL OF OUR PROGRAMS SUPPORT OUR MISSION.
IRS990.Description: ABBA HOUSE ABBA HOUSE WAS DWC'S FIRST PROGRAM AND IT OPENED WITH THE DIRECTION OF SISTER MARY VIRGINIA CLARK IN 1989. ABBA HOUSE IS A LARGE TWO STORY BUILDING THAT ACCOMMODATED 10 PRIVATE EFFICIENCY APARTMENTS WHERE WORMEN IN RECEOVERY FROM ADDISTIONS AND THEIR CHILDREN MAY LIVE UP TO 2 YEARS. DWC SERVED 33 WOMEN AND CHILDREN DURING 2009-2010. THESE OWMEN USUALLY HAVE 6 MONTHS SOBRIETY BEFORE ENTERING ABBA HOUSE FROM OUR OTHER SHELTER, HAVEN HOUSE. OF THE WOMEN COMPLETING OUR PROGRAM AND GRADUATING, 845 ARE STILL CLEAN AND SOBER 5 YEARS LATER. WE GRADUATED 7 WOMEN IN MARCH 2010. FUNDING FOR THIS PROGRAM CAME FROM SPEICAL EVENTS, GRANTS, AND SALES FROM OUR RETAIL STORES. EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE WAS PROVIDED TO OVER 200 HOMELESS AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS -PEOPLE IN NEED CONTACT DWC DAILY AND A CASE WORKER MAY ASSIST WITH BASIC NEEDS OF FOOD THROUGH THE DWC FOOD PANTRY AND REFERRALS TO THRIFT CITY FOR CLOTHING. -REFERRALS ARE GIVEN FOR RENTAL AND UTILITY ASSISTANCE, SHELTER, MEDICAL, DENTAL, AND MORE.

Activity2.Description: TRANSITIONAL HOUSING TRANSITIONAL HOUSING WAS STARTED AT DWC IN MARCH 2004. DWC CONTRACTED WITH THE CITY OF AMARILLO TO PROVIDE THE INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR 127 INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING 85 CHILDREN AND THE CITY PROVIDED THE SUBSIDIZED RENTAL ASSISTANCE. TRANSITIONAL HOUSING IS PARTIALLY FUNDED BY A CONTINUM OF CARE SUPER NOFA FEDERAL GRANT AND DWC PROVIDED THE REMAINING FUNDING GHROUGH SPECIAL EVENTS, GRANTS, AND SALES FROM OUR RETAIL STORES. THIS IS A TWO YEAR PROGRAM WITH FAMILIES LIVING IN HOUSING LOCATED THROUGHOUT AMARILLO. GRADUATES QUALIFY FOR SECTION 8 (HUD) HOUSING UPON GRADUATION. MANY OF THE WOMEN THAT GRADUATE THE DWC RECOVERY PROGRAM THROUGH OUR TWO SHELTERS MOVE INTO TRANSITIONAL HOUSING OR OUR MERIDIAN APARTMENTS. THE MAJORITY OF THE FAMILIES COME FROM OTHER SHELTERS IN AMARILLO.

Activity3.Description: HAVEN HOUSSE HAVEN HOUSE PROGRAM WAS STARTED IN APRIL 2007 AFTER THE 30 YEAR OLD WOMEN'S ALCOHOL AND DRUG RECOVERY CENTER DONATED THE FACILITY AT 1308 S BUCHANAN TO DWC. HAVEN HOUSE IS THE ENTRY LEVEL FOR THE DWC RECOVERY PROGRAM WITH BEDS FOR 17 WOMEN USUALLY NEW IN THEIR SUBSTANCE ABUSE RECOVERY. MANY OF THESE WOMEN CAME TO DWC FROM THE STREETS WITH SOME ONLY HAVING 24 HOURS SOBRIETY. MOST HAVE LOST EVERYTHING INCLUDING THEIR CHILDREN BY THE TIME THEY GET TO HAVEN HOUSE. THIS FACILITY HAS FOUR LARGE DORMS WITH 4 WOMEN LIVING IN 3 OF THE DORMS AND 5 WOMEN LIVING IN THE LARGEST DORM. CHILDREN ARE NOT ABLE TO RESIDE IN THIS FACILITY. HAVEN HOUSE WAS RENOVATED THE SUMMER OF 2008 MAKING THIS SHELTER A VERY WARM AND WELCOMING ATMOSPHERE. SEVENTY FOUR WOMEN WERE SERVED AND 24 GRADUATED TO ABBA HOUSE. A LICENSED CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY COUNSELOR (LCDC) SUPERVISES THE FACILITY AND HOLDS THE WOMEN ACCOUNTABLE FOR THEIR ACTIONS. HAVEN HOUSE IS A RECOVERY HOME AND IS NOT A LICENSED TREATMENT FACILITY. FUNDING SUPPORT COMES FROM INDIVIDUALS, GRANTS, SPECIAL EVENTS, AND SALES FROM OUR RETAIL STORES.

ActivityOther.Description: IN NOVEMBER 2003, DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER (DWC) OPENED ITS FIRST RETAIL STORE, THRIFT CITY. THRIFT CITY IS A THRIFT STORE STOCKED SOLELY FROM DONATIONS. THE ORIGINAL STORE HAD CLOTHING, SHOES, HOUSEHOLD ITEMS, FURNITURE, APPLIANCES, BOOKS, ETC. DUE TO THE HUGE SUCCESS OF THE BUSINESS, DWC COLLABORATED WITH CAL FARLEY'S BOYS RANCH TO OPEN THRIFT CITY 2 ON FEBURARY 14, 2006 FOR THE SALES OF FURNITURE AND APPLIANCES. IN FEBRUARY 2008, DWC OPENED ITS THIRD RETAIL STORE, THE UPTOWN SHOPPE. THE UPTOWN SHOPPE IS AN UPSCALE STORE WITH ANTIQUES, SILVER, CRYSTAL, FURNITURE, AND FINE, GENTLY WORN CLOTHING. THEY ALSO CARRY SEVERAL RETAIL LINES OF GIFT ITEMS AND SKIN CARE PRODUCTS. DWC'S RETAIL STORES HAVE THREE GOALS. RETAIL STORES PROVIDED JOBS TO 55 HOMELESS AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS -THRIFT CITY, THRIFT CITY 2, AND THE UPTOWN SHOPPE HIRED HOMELESS AND VERY LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS TO WORK IN OUR THREE STORES DOING A MULTITUDE OF JOBS: SORTING, HANGING, DISPLAYING MERCHANDISE, DRIVING AND WORKING ON OUR TRUCKS, MAINTENANCE AND JANITORIAL DUTIES, YARD WORK, AND MORE. -OUR RETAIL STORES HAVE GIVEN AWAY OVER 256,415 WORTH OF MERCHANDISE TO THOSE IN NEED IN OUR COMMUNITY BY REFERRAL FROM OVER 60 AGENCIES AND CHURCHES SINCE OUR FIRST STORE OPENED ON NOVEMBER 1, 2003. -THESE THREE STORES HAVE FINANCIALLY CONTRIBUTED TO PAYING THE ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS OF DWC AND ALL MONEY SOLICITED FROM SPECIAL EVENTS, GRANTS, AND INDIVIDUALS GO TO THE SUPPORT OF OUR PROGRAMS. TO FUND THE PROGRAMS OF DWC. MOST OF THE WOMEN LIVING IN ABBA HOUSE OR HAVEN HOUSE HAVE HEALTH PROBLEMS, CRIMINAL BACKGROUNDS, AND LOW SELF-ESTEEM. MOST HAVE LIMITED JOB EXPERIENCE AND DO NOT KNOW HOW TO MANAGE MONEY. THROUGH JOB TRAINING PROGRAMS AT OUR RETAIL STORES, MANY OF THESE WOMEN BEGIN TO LIVE AS PRODUCTIVE CITIZENS FOR THE FIRST TIME IN THEIR LIVES. THEY MUST REMAIN CLEAN AND SOBER AND DRUG TESTING IS DONE PERIODICALLY. THE TRAINING THEY RECEIVE WHILE IN OUR PROGRAM ALLOWS THEM TO MOVE ON TO FULL-TIME JOBS IN THE COMMUNITY. OUR RETAIL STORES PROVIDE JOBS AND JOB TRAINING TO THE HOMELESS, SENIORS, PHYSICALLY AND/OR MENTALLY CHALLENGED AND IN GENERAL - THOSE WHO ARE HARD TO EMPLOY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: EXPLANATION ON VOLUNTEERS AND TYPES OF SERVICES OR BENEFITS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DOWNTOWN WOMEN'S CENTER UTILIZES VOLUNTEERS IN THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICES ANSWERING THE PHONES, DATA ENTRY, CORRESPONDENCE, AND WITH MAILOUTS. OUR THRIFT STORES HAVE VOLUNTEER SORTERS, HANGERS, CASHIERS, DRIVERS, AND DISPLAYERS. OTHER VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE MEALS FOR THE HOMELESS PEOPLE IN OUR PROGRAMS, DO MAINTENANCE (YARD WORK, PAINTING, ETC.), MENTOR, AND PROVIDE CHILDCARE IN THE TRANSITIONAL HOUSING PROGRAM.

EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE WAS PROVIDED TO OVER 200 HOMELESS AND LOW INCOME INDIVIDUALS -PEOPLE IN NEED CONTACT DWC DAILY AND A CASE WORKER MAY ASSIST WITH BASIC NEEDS OF FOOD THROUGH THE DWC FOOD PANTRY AND REFERRALS TO THRIFT CITY FOR CLOTHING. -REFERRALS ARE GIVEN FOR RENTAL AND UTILITY ASSISTANCE, SHELTER, MEDICAL, DENTAL, AND MORE.
THROUGH OUR TWO SHELTERS MOVE INTO TRANSITIONAL HOUSING OR OUR MERIDIAN APARTMENTS. THE MAJORITY OF THE FAMILIES COME FROM OTHER SHELTERS IN AMARILLO.

RESIDE IN THIS FACILITY. HAVEN HOUSE WAS RENOVATED THE SUMMER OF 2008 MAKING THIS SHELTER A VERY WARM AND WELCOMING ATMOSPHERE. SEVENTY FOUR WOMEN WERE SERVED AND 24 GRADUATED TO ABBA HOUSE. FUNDING SUPPORT COMES FROM INDIVIDUALS, GRANTS, SPECIAL EVENTS, AND SALES FROM OUR RETAIL STORES.

MIKE KOEHLER MARY SCHOOLER DIRECTOR DIRECTOR BROTHER AND SISTER

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NO REVIEW WAS OR WILL BE CONDUCTED.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE DWC WILL NOT PERSONALLY BENEFIT FROM DWC CONTRACTS, FROM FUNDRAISING EVENTS FOR THE DWC, FROM PUBLICITY GIVEN TO THE DWC OR FROM ANY OTHER MEANS OF MAKING PERSONAL GAINS IN CONNECTION TO THE DWC. THE BOARD AGREES THAT: ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF DWC WILL COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT FORM ANNUALLY TO DISCLOSE UP FRONT ANY KNOWN CONFLICTS. CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE FILLED OUT ANNUALLY UPON ELECTION OF NEW OFFICERS AND INSTALLATION OF NEW BOARD MEMBERS. MEMBERS WANTING TO BID ON A PROJECT MUST STEP DOWN FROM THE BOARD. ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST MUST BE DECLARED BEFORE ANY PROJECT IS BEGAN.

DWC RESEARCHES SALARIES THROUGH THE INTERNET, COMPARES THEM TO LOCAL POSITIONS, AND FIT THEM INTO THE HIERARCHY OF EXISITING PAYSCALES FOR THE OTHER EMPLOYEES. THE DWC BOARD DETERMINES THE SALARY AND RAISES FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AFTER A COMPANY WIDE EVALUATION OF THE DIRECTOR BY ALL EMPLOYEES.

DWC RESEARCHES SALARIES THROUGH THE INTERNET, COMPARES THEM TO LOCAL POSITIONS, AND FIT THEM INTO THE HIERARCHY OF EXISITING PAYSCALES FOR THE OTHER EMPLOYEES. THE DWC BOARD DETERMINES THE SALARY AND RAISES FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AFTER A COMPANY WIDE EVALUATION OF THE DIRECTOR BY ALL EMPLOYEES.
DWC POSTS ITS 990'S ON ITS WEBSITE. ALL OTHER GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO ANYONE UPON REQUEST.
